```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
nums = sample(2:9,2)
A = nums[1]
B = nums[2]
am = "B(x+A)"
ad = "\\frac{x+A}{B}"
sm = "B(x-A)"
sd = "\\frac{x-A}{B}"
ma = "Ax+B"
da = "\\frac{x}{A}+B"
ms = "Ax-B"
ds = "\\frac{x}{A}-B"
qs = c(am,ad,sm,sd,ma,da,ms,ds)

wd = c("add A and then multiply by B",
       "add A and then divide by B",
       "subtract A and then multiply by B",
       "subtract A and then divide by B",
       "multiply by A and then add B",
       "divide by A and then add B",
       "multiply by A and then subtract B",
       "divide by A and then subtract B")

qt = sample(1:8,1)
fexp = qs[qt]
fwd = wd[qt]
iexp = qs[9-qt]
iwd = wd[9-qt]

fexp = gsub("A",nums[1],fexp,fixed=T)
fexp = gsub("B",nums[2],fexp,fixed=T)

iexp = gsub("B",nums[1],iexp,fixed=T)
iexp = gsub("A",nums[2],iexp,fixed=T)

while(T){
    x = sample(3:100,1)
    ys = c((x+A)*B,(x+A)/B,(x-A)*B,(x-A)/B,x*A+B,x/A+B,x*A-B,x/A-B)
    y = ys[qt]
    if(length(unique(c(x,y,A,B)))==4 && y%%1==0 && y>0 && y<100){break}
}

```

Question
========

Let function $f$ be defined by the algebraic expression below:

$$f(x)~=~`r fexp`$$

Evaluate $f(`r x`)$.


Solution
========

Plug `r x` into the expression to evaluate $f(`r x`)$.

$$f(`r x`)~=~`r gsub("x",paste0("(",x,")"),fexp,fixed=T)`$$

Use arithmetic and PEMDAS (order of operations).

$$f(`r x`)~=~`r y`$$
